chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
f: bool -> bool -> bool
x: bool
l: lb
y: bool
m: lb

Goal:
lb_pointwise (x :: l) (y :: m) = f x y :: lb_pointwise l m

Premises:
Inductive bool : Set := true : bool | false : bool
lb_pointwise = fix lb_pointwise (l m : lb) {struct l} : lb := match l with | nil => match m with | nil => nil | _ :: _ => map (f ⟘) m end | x :: l0 => match m with | nil => map (fun x0 : bool => f x0 ⟘) l | y :: m0 => f x y :: lb_pointwise l0 m0 end end : lb -> lb -> lb Arguments lb_pointwise (_ _)%list_scope
lb_pointwise_left : forall l : lb, lb_pointwise l nil = map (fun x : bool => f x ⟘) l
Inductive ascii : Set := Ascii : bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> Ascii.ascii Arguments Ascii.Ascii (_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _)%bool_scope
andb = fun b1 b2 : bool => if b1 then b2 else ⟘ : bool -> bool -> bool Arguments andb (_ _)%bool_scope
orb = fun b1 b2 : bool => if b1 then ⟙ else b2 : bool -> bool -> bool Arguments orb (_ _)%bool_scope
Ring.bool_eq = fun b1 b2 : bool => if b1 then b2 else negb b2 : bool -> bool -> bool Arguments Ring.bool_eq (_ _)%bool_scope
lb_mask_sind : forall P : lb -> lb -> SProp, (forall l : lb, P nil l) -> (forall l : lb, l ⪯ nil -> P l nil -> P (⟘ :: l) nil) -> (forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x ⪦ y -> l ⪯ m -> P l m -> P (x :: l) (y :: m)) -> forall l l0 : lb, l ⪯ l0 -> P l l0
lb_mask_ind : forall P : lb -> lb -> Prop, (forall l : lb, P nil l) -> (forall l : lb, l ⪯ nil -> P l nil -> P (⟘ :: l) nil) -> (forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x ⪦ y -> l ⪯ m -> P l m -> P (x :: l) (y :: m)) -> forall l l0 : lb, l ⪯ l0 -> P l l0
lb_ortho_ind : forall P : lb -> lb -> Prop, (forall l : lb, P nil l) -> (forall l : lb, P l nil) -> (forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x = ⟘ \/ y = ⟘ -> l ⟂ m -> P l m -> P (x :: l) (y :: m)) -> forall l l0 : lb, l ⟂ l0 -> P l l0
lb_ortho_sind : forall P : lb -> lb -> SProp, (forall l : lb, P nil l) -> (forall l : lb, P l nil) -> (forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x = ⟘ \/ y = ⟘ -> l ⟂ m -> P l m -> P (x :: l) (y :: m)) -> forall l l0 : lb, l ⟂ l0 -> P l l0
map_cons : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (x : A) (l : list A), map f (x :: l) = f x :: map f l
Bool.le = fun b1 b2 : bool => if b1 then b2 = ⟙ else True : bool -> bool -> Prop Arguments Bool.le (_ _)%bool_scope
xorb = fun b1 b2 : bool => if b1 then if b2 then ⟘ else ⟙ else if b2 then ⟙ else ⟘ : bool -> bool -> bool Arguments xorb (_ _)%bool_scope
Forall2_sind : forall (A B : Type) (R : A -> B -> Prop) (P : list A -> list B -> SProp), P nil nil -> (forall (x : A) (y : B) (l : list A) (l' : list B), R x y -> Forall2 R l l' -> P l l' -> P (x :: l) (y :: l')) -> forall (l : list A) (l0 : list B), Forall2 R l l0 -> P l l0
Forall2_ind : forall (A B : Type) (R : A -> B -> Prop) (P : list A -> list B -> Prop), P nil nil -> (forall (x : A) (y : B) (l : list A) (l' : list B), R x y -> Forall2 R l l' -> P l l' -> P (x :: l) (y :: l')) -> forall (l : list A) (l0 : list B), Forall2 R l l0 -> P l l0
Ring.BoolTheory = {| Ring_theory.Radd_0_l := fun x : bool => if x as b return ((if b then ⟙ else ⟘) = b) then eq_refl else eq_refl; Ring_theory.Radd_comm := fun x : bool => if x as b return (forall y : bool, xorb b y = xorb y b) then fun y : bool => if y as b return (xorb ⟙ b = xorb b ⟙) then eq_refl else eq_refl else fun y : bool => if y as b return (xorb ⟘ b = xorb b ⟘) then eq_refl else eq_refl; Ring_theory.Radd_assoc := fun x : bool => if x as b return (forall y z : bool, xorb b (xorb y z) = xorb (xorb b y) z) then fun y : bool => if y as b return (forall z : bool, xorb ⟙ (xorb b z) = xorb (xorb ⟙ b) z) then fun z : bool...
BinPosDef.Pos.leb = fun x y : BinNums.positive => match BinPosDef.Pos.compare x y with | Gt => ⟘ | _ => ⟙ end : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive -> bool Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.leb (_ _)%positive_scope
BinIntDef.Z.gtb = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match BinIntDef.Z.compare x y with | Gt => ⟙ | _ => ⟘ end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> bool Arguments BinIntDef.Z.gtb (_ _)%Z_scope
partition_cons2 : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (a : A) (l l1 l2 : list A), partition f l = (l1, l2) -> f a = ⟘ -> partition f (a :: l) = (l1, a :: l2)
partition_cons1 : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (a : A) (l l1 l2 : list A), partition f l = (l1, l2) -> f a = ⟙ -> partition f (a :: l) = (a :: l1, l2)
Inductive Forall2 (A B : Type) (R : A -> B -> Prop) : list A -> list B -> Prop := Forall2_nil : Forall2 R nil nil | Forall2_cons : forall (x : A) (y : B) (l : list A) (l' : list B), R x y -> Forall2 R l l' -> Forall2 R (x :: l) (y :: l') Arguments Forall2 [A B]%type_scope _%function_scope (_ _)%list_scope Arguments Forall2_nil [A B]%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments Forall2_cons [A B]%type_scope [R]%function_scope _ _ [l l']%list_scope
ZMicromega.Zunsat = RingMicromega.check_inconsistent BinNums.Z0 Zbool.Zeq_bool BinInt.Z.leb : RingMicromega.NFormula BinNums.Z -> bool
Inductive bool : Set := true : bool | false : bool
Field_theory.PExpr_eq : forall C : Type, (C -> C -> bool) -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> bool
Ring_polynom.Peq : forall C : Type, (C -> C -> bool) -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> bool
lb_pointwise_right : forall l : lb, lb_pointwise nil l = map (f ⟘) l
